meanings.definition: The act of committing harm or evil.
meanings.sent1: The maleficence of the villain led to the destruction of the peaceful village.
meanings.sent2: The maleficence of the witch was evident in her curses and hexes.
meanings.sent3: The maleficence of the mischievous imp caused chaos in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The maleficence of the storm left a trail of devastation in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The maleficence of the dragon was feared by all who crossed its path.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being malevolent or harmful.
meanings.sent1: The darkness in his eyes revealed the maleficence of his intentions.
meanings.sent2: The maleficence of the dictator was felt by all who opposed him.
meanings.sent3: The maleficence of the haunted house made it a popular spot for thrill-seekers.
meanings.sent4: The maleficence of the poison slowly spread through the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The maleficence of the curse haunted the town for generations.
